parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To roll away. From apo and kulioo; to roll away.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Exceedingly, greatly, very much. Neuter plural of sphodros as adverb; vehemently, i.e. In a high degree, much.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
